If....

"It's a natural characteristic of adolescents to want to proclaim individuality... It's a quite blameless form of existentialism".

York's music and clubbing scene

Once you've unpacked, done your hair, met your flatmates and checked your timetable, the more musically minded freshers among you will probably want to investigate York's noble music scene.

Laura Hulley

As we all climb out the gentle coma that the fuzzy summer months brought, the last memories of long, light nights and slow, grinding hangovers are still memorable - just.

Leeds Piano Competition '09

The tribulations of Leeds Pianoforte Competition are <strong>Peter Campbell'</strong>s subject of choice.

Nouse Playlist

<strong>Laura Hulley</strong> <em>Jay Z ft. Alicia Keys</em> <strong>Isaac Hewlings</strong><em>Wolfgang Gartner</em> <strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong> <em>Chromeo</em>

Melt!

The Melt electro night has been around since the beginning of last term, yet it seems to be steadily growing in stature and blending into the environment of York's small underground electronic music scene.

Dream Theater

The American progressive metal band, comprising of five members of virtuosic ability, have had an epic history.

Polly Morgan

One might be forgiven for presuming a topic like taxidermy to be more familiar to a demographic of middle aged men.

Antonia Shaw

Whitewashed shop windows, dilapidated signage and decaying frontages are a testament to and constant reminder of the economic turmoil we are currently living in.

Contemporary Arts

Under the current financial climate, headline stories such as Damien Hirst's record breaking $199 million one man auction at Sotheby's 2008 seem memories of a by gone era.

Equus

Despite being described by the director as a piece that represents characters suppressed by society and its expectations, York Theatre Royal's depiction of Peter Shaffer's infamous twentieth-century play seems to visually deny all sense of society

Sashiko Textiles

The first exhibition of this traditional Japanese craft in the UK comes to York Art Gallery courtesy of guest curator Michele Walker whose research has focused on sashiko textile work

Soren Bach

Millinery is essential to the atmosphere of an outfit. <strong>Liam O'Brien</strong> interviews Soren Bach, maker of headwear-extraordinaire.

Sofia Redgrave

As this is a special freshers' edition, I thought I should save my comments on this season's London Fashion Week, (size 12 models on the catwalk, Anna Wintour, and Burberry!) and hopefully tell you something useful about shopping in York

Pippa Small

<strong>Hannah Smith</strong> and <strong>Laura Connor</strong> talk to the charitable jewellery designer

Henry James Foy

Vintage fashion fairs

Vintage, fashion and fair. Three words to get any self respecting style enthusiast excited indeed.

Michael Jackson: Fashion Retrospective

Michael Jackson was undoubtedly a singing legend, but his diverse fashionable look also influenced designers, trends, fans, fashion editors and stylists alike.
